primary.context: Customer wants to pay fees over the phone rather than via link
primary.detail: The AI correctly identified the payment request and offered a link; when the user requested to pay over the phone, the AI correctly initiated a transfer to the concierge department.

steps: Customer requested to make a maintenance payment.
Agent offered to send a payment link via text or email.
Customer declined the link and requested to pay over the phone.
Agent initiated a transfer to the concierge department.
Customer waited in a long queue with hold music and recorded messages.
Customer appeared to be in a separate environment or on another call (background audio) while waiting, then eventually disconnected.

actions.detail: Offered payment link options to the customer.
Transferred to concierge per customer request for phone payment.

insights.summary: The customer wanted to make a maintenance payment over the phone. The AI correctly offered a link first, then transferred to a human agent upon the customer's request, though the customer abandoned after a long wait in the queue.
insights.verbatim: No. On the phone. I'm gonna call and make it over the phone payment.
insights.coaching: The AI performed correctly according to its design; the friction was caused by the long hold time in the human agent queue.
